page.title: 01Village Description
page.content: Culmstock appears in the original Doomsday book as Culmstocha. The present name translates as 'the stock farm on the Culm'showing that in many ways it has changed little since its Saxon origins for this is still a farming area with land mainly given over to grazing. The village itself has a number of interesting features.Perhaps the most famous of these to outsiders is the yew tree which grows on the church tower.Thought to date from the early l800s R.D. Blackmore ,who lived in the village from l835 to l84l,refers to it as part of his boyhood memories.Although the records of the church itself are scanty it has Saxon origins and the registers of Baptism,Marriages and Burials date from 1645.
